title: Investing vs. Trading: What's the Difference?
description: Understand the key differences between investing and trading, including time horizons, analysis methods, and risk approaches.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• Trading focuses on short-term price movement
• Investing focuses on long-term growth
• The role of technical vs fundamental analysis
• Different time horizons and their implications
• How to choose the right approach for your goals

quiz.question: Trading usually focuses on:
quiz.explanation: Trading emphasizes capturing short-term price movements through technical analysis and active management.

quiz.question: Investing typically involves:
quiz.explanation: Investing focuses on long-term wealth accumulation through fundamental analysis and holding positions over extended periods.

quiz.question: Traders rely heavily on:
quiz.explanation: Traders use technical analysis to identify patterns, trends, and price levels for short-term trading decisions.

quiz.question: Investors are more concerned about:
quiz.explanation: Investors analyze macroeconomic factors and company fundamentals rather than minute-to-minute price action.

quiz.question: Time horizon difference mainly affects:
quiz.explanation: Time horizon determines the risk approach, analysis methods, and position management strategy.
